%+v for both this and the next line?

oh, nvm, I guess this is test code

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +130,134 @@	requestBody := body(c.Request.Body, c.Request.RawBody)
	actualQuery := c.handler.RequestReceived.URL.Query()
	t.Logf("got query: %v", actualQuery)
	t.Logf("path: %v", c.Request.Path)
	// We check the query manually, so blank it out so that FakeHandler.ValidateRequest

comments.body: Is this one supposed to be different from all the others? (NewContext vs NewDefaultContext?)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +303,307 @@		},
	}
	receivedControllerList, err := c.Setup().ListReplicationControllers(api.NewContext(), labels.Everything())
	c.Validate(t, receivedControllerList, err)

comments.body:
My mind is just blown that we have testing function which is returning a `*string`. Yes, it'd be an extra few copies to return just a straight string but this is not a good time or place to be optimizing, and if we _really_ wanted to optimize, we should be tossing around []byte, NOT *string.

So I would recommend scrolling up to the body function above and making it return something sane.
It appears that the use of the pointer is not to optimize, but so that a nil value can be used as a "don't care" value in expectations.
I see; I hate it a tiny fraction less. I still think it should be []byte.
I'd feel more comfortable changing this in a separate PR. I don't understand testClient well enough to do it quickly.
Can we stick to the term "selector" instead of "query"?
Maybe we can move this to the test instead, instead of doing dynamic validation in the Client Validate method.

@lavalamp this refers to the URL query params, rather than the label query, so I think Query is right.

@proppy this is the only way to keep your generic "validate" method and make this work.

@brendanburns Yes, I was suggesting you might not want to have `Validate()` check the querystring for this particular test.

And do the validation yourself in the test instead.
Sounds good, I'm OK with that usage of query.

comments addressed. ptal.

thanks!
--brendan

On Fri, Jun 20, 2014 at 10:22 AM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pkg/client/client_test.go:
> 
> > @@ -280,6 +299,11 @@ type TestClient struct {
> >     server   *httptest.Server
> >     handler  *util.FakeHandler
> >     Target   interface{}
> > -   // For query args, an optional function to validate the contents
> > -   // useful when the contents can change but still be correct.
> > -   // Maps from query arg key to validator.
> > -   // If no validator is present, string equality is used.
> > -   QueryValidator map[string]func(string, string) bool
> 
> Sounds good, I'm OK with that usage of query.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/189/files#r14030836
> .

Let me be more explicit about what I was suggesting, you could switch r.Request.Query to be a pointer, and not validate it if it's `nil`.

And for that particular test, rather that doing the validation in `Validate()` generically, you do it specifically in your test.
Discussed on IM, but given that a lot of the rest is generic, I prefer sticking w/ the generic approach here, rather than doing manual validation in the individual test.
FYI, you could inline that in the TestClient literal.
